Package com.ezasm.assembler

Interface Directive

All Known Implementing Classes:
Directive.CreateLabel, Directive.SetSection, Directive.Write, Directive.WriteIInstruction, Directive.WriteRInstruction
public sealed interface Directive permits Directive.Write, Directive.SetSection, Directive.CreateLabel, Directive.WriteRInstruction, Directive.WriteIInstruction
Object to be executed by an Assembler instance that modifies the state of the instance in some way.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description
    static final record 
    Directive.CreateLabel
    A basic Directive implementation that creates a label in at the current section offset of an Assembler instance.
    static final record 
    Directive.SetSection
    A basic Directive implementation that sets the current section of an Assembler instance.
    static final record 
    Directive.Write
    A basic Directive implementation that writes an array of bytes to the current section of an Assembler instance.
    static final record 
    Directive.WriteIInstruction
    A Directive that writes a MIPS instruction in the current section of an Assembler instance using the MIPS Immediate encoding.
    static final record 
    Directive.WriteRInstruction
    A Directive that writes a MIPS instruction in the current section of an Assembler instance using the MIPS Register encoding.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    invoke(Assembler assembler)
    Called by an Assembler instance during assembly.
    int
    priority()
    The priority of a Directive determines when it is invoked by an Assembler instance.
    int
    size()
    Used by the assembler to pre-calculate Directive sizes and section offsets.

  • Method Details

    • invoke

      void invoke(Assembler assembler)
      Called by an Assembler instance during assembly.
      Parameters:
      assembler - the assembler that this Directive should act on.

    • priority

      int priority()
      The priority of a Directive determines when it is invoked by an Assembler instance. All priority 0 Directives are invoked first, followed by all priority 1 Directives, and so on until all Directives have been invoked.
      Returns:
      the priority value of this Directive.

    • size

      int size()
      Used by the assembler to pre-calculate Directive sizes and section offsets.
      Returns:
      The size, in bytes, of the data generated by this Directive.
